concepts.concept_name: Laws of chemical combination and Dalton's atomic theory
Mole concept, molar mass, and Avogadro's number
Stoichiometry and limiting reagent calculations
Empirical and molecular formula determination

in_scope: Laws of conservation of mass, definite proportions, and multiple proportions
Atomic and molecular masses, mole concept
Percentage composition and empirical/molecular formula
Stoichiometric calculations involving reactions in solution
Concentration terms: molarity, molality, mole fraction, ppm
out_of_scope: Advanced thermodynamic derivations of chemical laws
Quantum mechanical basis of atomic theory

concepts.concept_name: Bohr's model, hydrogen spectrum, and atomic spectra
Quantum mechanical model: quantum numbers and orbitals
Electronic configuration and filling of orbitals (Aufbau, Pauli, Hund's rule)

in_scope: Thomson, Rutherford, and Bohr models of the atom
De Broglie relation and Heisenberg uncertainty principle
Quantum numbers (n, l, ml, ms) and shapes of s, p, d orbitals
Aufbau principle, Pauli exclusion principle, Hund's rule
Electronic configurations of elements up to Z=30
out_of_scope: Schrodinger wave equation derivation and solutions

concepts.concept_name: Modern periodic table and electronic configuration basis
Periodic trends: ionization enthalpy, electron gain enthalpy, electronegativity
Atomic and ionic radii trends across periods and groups

in_scope: Genesis of periodic classification: Mendeleev to modern periodic law
s, p, d, f block classification and nomenclature
Trends in atomic radius, ionic radius, ionization enthalpy
Electron gain enthalpy, electronegativity (Pauling scale)
Variation of valence and oxidation states across periods
out_of_scope: Detailed properties of individual elements beyond general trends
Mulliken and Allred-Rochow electronegativity scales in depth
Band theory or solid-state explanations of periodicity

concepts.concept_name: Ionic and covalent bonding, Lewis structures, and formal charge
VSEPR theory and molecular geometry prediction
Hybridization (sp, sp2, sp3, sp3d, sp3d2) and shapes of molecules
Molecular orbital theory for homonuclear diatomic molecules

in_scope: Kossel-Lewis approach to chemical bonding
Lattice enthalpy and Born-Haber cycle (basic)
VSEPR theory: linear, trigonal planar, tetrahedral, and other geometries
Valence bond theory and concept of resonance
Hybridization and overlap of orbitals
Molecular orbital diagrams for O2, N2, F2
Bond order, bond length, bond energy relationships
Hydrogen bonding and van der Waals forces
out_of_scope: Molecular orbital theory for heteronuclear diatomics beyond basics

concepts.concept_name: Gas laws: Boyle's, Charles's, Avogadro's, and ideal gas equation
Kinetic molecular theory of gases and Maxwell-Boltzmann distribution
Real gases, van der Waals equation, and liquefaction

in_scope: Boyle's law, Charles's law, Gay Lussac's law, Avogadro's law
Ideal gas equation PV = nRT and numerical problems
Dalton's law of partial pressures and Graham's law of diffusion
Kinetic energy and molecular speeds (rms, average, most probable)
Deviation from ideal behaviour and van der Waals equation
Critical temperature, liquefaction of gases
Intermolecular interactions and liquid state properties
out_of_scope: Virial equation of state beyond second virial coefficient
Detailed phase diagrams and supercritical fluids

concepts.concept_name: First law of thermodynamics, internal energy, enthalpy, and heat capacity
Hess's law and enthalpy of reactions (formation, combustion, bond dissociation)
Second and third laws: entropy, spontaneity, and Gibbs free energy

in_scope: System, surroundings, state functions, and types of processes
First law: internal energy, work, heat, and enthalpy
Hess's law and enthalpy calculations (formation, combustion, atomization, lattice)
Born-Haber cycle for ionic compounds
Entropy, second law of thermodynamics
Gibbs free energy: spontaneity criteria (delta G = delta H - T delta S)
Third law and absolute entropy
out_of_scope: Carnot cycle and heat engine efficiency calculations

concepts.concept_name: Law of chemical equilibrium, equilibrium constant (Kc, Kp), and Le Chatelier's principle
Ionic equilibrium: acids, bases, pH, and buffer solutions
Solubility product (Ksp) and common ion effect

in_scope: Equilibrium in physical and chemical processes
Law of mass action and equilibrium constant expressions
Relationship between Kc and Kp
Le Chatelier's principle and factors affecting equilibrium
Arrhenius, Bronsted-Lowry, and Lewis concepts of acids and bases
pH scale, ionization of weak acids/bases, Ka, Kb
Henderson-Hasselbalch equation and buffer solutions
Solubility equilibria and common ion effect
out_of_scope: Activity coefficients and non-ideal solution equilibrium
Equilibrium in biochemical systems in detail

concepts.concept_name: Oxidation number assignment and identification of redox reactions
Balancing redox equations by oxidation number and half-reaction methods
Types of redox reactions: combination, decomposition, disproportionation

in_scope: Classical concept of oxidation and reduction
Electron transfer and oxidation number approaches
Rules for assigning oxidation numbers
Balancing equations in acidic and basic media
Types: combination, decomposition, displacement, disproportionation
Redox reactions in electrode processes (introductory)
out_of_scope: Electrochemical cell EMF calculations (covered in Class 12)

concepts.concept_name: Position of hydrogen in periodic table, isotopes, and preparation methods
Properties and structure of water, heavy water, and hydrogen peroxide
Types of hydrides: ionic, covalent, and interstitial

in_scope: Position of hydrogen in periodic table and its unique nature
Isotopes of hydrogen: protium, deuterium, tritium
Dihydrogen: preparation, properties, and uses
Hydrides: ionic, covalent, and interstitial classification
Water: structure, properties, hard and soft water
Heavy water (D2O) and its properties
Hydrogen peroxide: preparation, structure, properties, and uses
Hydrogen as a fuel
out_of_scope: Hydrogen fuel cell technology in engineering detail
Industrial hydrogen production at scale (Haber process detail in Class 12)

concepts.concept_name: Alkali metals (Group 1): electronic configuration, properties, and compounds
Alkaline earth metals (Group 2): properties, diagonal relationship, and compounds
Important compounds: NaOH, Na2CO3, NaHCO3, CaO, Ca(OH)2, Plaster of Paris

in_scope: General electronic configuration and trends in Group 1 and 2
Physical and chemical properties of alkali and alkaline earth metals
Anomalous properties of lithium and beryllium
Diagonal relationship between Li-Mg and Be-Al
Preparation and properties of NaOH, Na2CO3, NaHCO3
CaO, Ca(OH)2, CaSO4·½H2O (Plaster of Paris), CaCO3
Industrial uses and biological importance of Na, K, Mg, Ca
out_of_scope: Advanced coordination chemistry of Group 2 metals

concepts.concept_name: Group 13 elements: boron family, properties, and boron compounds
Group 14 elements: carbon family, allotropes, and silicon compounds
Important compounds: borax, boric acid, diborane, silicones, silicates, and zeolites

in_scope: General introduction to p-block elements (Groups 13 and 14 only for Class 11)
Electronic configuration, oxidation states, and trends in Group 13
Boron: borax, boric acid, boron hydrides (diborane), BF3
Aluminium: reactions and amphoteric nature
Electronic configuration, catenation, and allotropy in Group 14
Carbon: allotropes (diamond, graphite, fullerenes), oxides, carbides
Silicon: silicones, silicates, zeolites
Important trends: inert pair effect
out_of_scope: Detailed semiconductor physics of silicon and germanium

concepts.concept_name: IUPAC nomenclature, structural and stereoisomerism
Electronic displacement effects: inductive, resonance, hyperconjugation
Reactive intermediates: carbocations, carbanions, free radicals, carbenes
Purification and qualitative analysis of organic compounds

in_scope: Classification and general characteristics of organic compounds
Tetravalence of carbon, hybridization, and shapes
IUPAC nomenclature of alkanes, alkenes, alkynes, and functional groups
Structural isomerism and stereoisomerism (geometrical, optical)
Electronic displacement: inductive effect, electromeric effect, resonance, hyperconjugation
Homolytic and heterolytic fission, types of reagents
Carbocations, carbanions, free radicals: stability order
Methods of purification: distillation, crystallization, chromatography
Qualitative analysis: detection of C, H, N, S, halogens
out_of_scope: Advanced stereochemistry (R/S configuration in depth, conformational analysis)
Reaction mechanisms in detail (SN1, SN2 covered in Class 12)
Spectroscopic methods: IR, NMR, mass spectrometry in depth

concepts.concept_name: Alkanes: preparation, properties, conformations, and combustion
Alkenes and alkynes: preparation, addition reactions, and Markovnikov's rule
Aromatic hydrocarbons: benzene structure, aromaticity, and electrophilic substitution

in_scope: Alkanes: Wurtz reaction, free radical halogenation, combustion, conformations of ethane
Alkenes: preparation by dehydration/dehydrohalogenation, addition of H2, HX (Markovnikov/anti-Markovnikov), ozonolysis
Alkynes: acidic character of terminal alkynes, addition reactions
Benzene: Kekule structure, resonance, aromaticity (Huckel's rule)
Electrophilic aromatic substitution: halogenation, nitration, sulphonation, Friedel-Crafts
Directive effects of substituents (ortho/para and meta)
Carcinogenicity and toxicity awareness of hydrocarbons
out_of_scope: Petroleum refining and petrochemical industry processes
Advanced pericyclic reactions and orbital symmetry

concepts.concept_name: Air pollution: causes, effects, smog, ozone depletion, and acid rain
Water pollution: causes, BOD, and water treatment methods
Green chemistry: principles and strategies for pollution prevention

in_scope: Environmental pollution: air, water, and soil
Atmospheric pollutants: oxides of carbon, nitrogen, sulphur; particulates
Smog (classical and photochemical), acid rain mechanism
Ozone layer depletion: CFCs and the ozone hole
Greenhouse effect and global warming
Water pollution: domestic and industrial, BOD, eutrophication
Soil pollution: pesticides and industrial waste
Green chemistry: atom economy, use of safer solvents, pollution prevention
out_of_scope: Climate modelling and quantitative environmental science
